intro: Lappula popovii, commonly known as the Siberian yellowweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, saline soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in a fine layer of salt crystals. Lappula popovii is often found in steppes and deserts, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
